This code system http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0510 defines the following codes:

CodeDisplayDefinitionV2 Concept CommentV2 Concept Comment As Published
RI Received into inventory (for specified patient)Received into inventory (for specified patient)Status determined by FillerStatus determined by Filler
RD Reserved and ready to dispenseReserved and ready to dispenseStatus determined by FillerStatus determined by Filler
RS Reserved (ordered and product allocated for the patient)Reserved (ordered and product allocated for the patient)Status determined by FillerStatus determined by Filler
RE Released (no longer allocated for the patient)Released (no longer allocated for the patient)Status determined by Placer or FillerStatus determined by Placer or Filler
DS Dispensed to patient locationDispensed to patient locationStatus determined by FillerStatus determined by Filler
RA Returned unused/no longer neededReturned unused/no longer neededStatus determined by FillerStatus determined by Filler
RL Returned unused/keep linked to patient for possible use laterReturned unused/keep linked to patient for possible use laterStatus determined by FillerStatus determined by Filler
WA Wasted (product no longer viable)Wasted (product no longer viable)Status determined by FillerStatus determined by Filler
PT Presumed transfused (dispensed and not returned)Presumed transfused (dispensed and not returned)Status determined by FillerStatus determined by Filler
CR Released into inventory for general availabilityReleased into inventory for general availabilityStatus determined by FillerStatus determined by Filler
RQ Request to dispense blood productRequest to dispense blood productStatus determined by PlacerStatus determined by Placer

name: BloodProductDispenseStatus
title: bloodProductDispenseStatus
description: HL7-defined code system of concepts used to specify the current status of the specified blood product as indicated by the filler or placer.  For example, the first status change of a product that may trigger a Blood Product Dispense Status Message occurs when it first becomes linked to a patient and is ready to dispense. The placer system may use the Blood Product Dispense Status Message to request the transfusion service to dispense the product.  When the blood product is delivered or issued to a patient, the status of the blood product would be changed to indicate that it has now been "dispensed".  Used in the Blood Product Dispense Status (BPX) segment in HL7 Version 2.x messaging.
purpose: Underlying Master Code System for V2 table 0510 (Blood Product Dispense Status)
copyright: Copyright HL7. Licensed under creative commons public domain
